verses.verse: ((2 Tola dieth.5 Jair also dieth.7 The Israelites are punished for their sins.10 They cry unto God,16 and he hath pity on them.) ) After Abimelech, there arose to defend Israel, Tola, the son of Puah, the son of (Or, his uncle.) Dodo, a man of Issachar, which dwelt in Shamir in mount Ephraim.
And he (Or, governed.) judged Israel three and twenty years, and died, and was buried in Shamir.
¶ And after him arose Jair a Gileadite, and judged Israel two and twenty years.

And he had thirty sons that (Signifying, they were men of authority.) rode on thirty asscolts, and they had thirty cities, which are called (Or, the towns of Jair, as Deut. 3:14.) Havoth Jair unto this day, and are in the land of Gilead.
And Jair died, and was buried in Camon.

¶ (Cross references: : Judg. 2:11; Judg. 3:7; Judg. 4:1; Judg. 6:1; Judg. 13:1) And the children of Israel wrought wickedness again in the sight of the Lord, and served Baal and (Judg. 2:13) Ashtoreth, and the gods of (Or, Syrian.) Aram, and the gods of Sidon, and the gods of Moab, and the gods of the children of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines, and forsook the Lord and served not him.
Therefore the wrath of the Lord was kindled against Israel, and he (Or, delivered.) sold them into the hands of the Philistines, and into the hands of the children of Ammon:

Who from that year vexed and oppressed the children of Israel eighteen years, (As the Reubenites, Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh.) even all the children of Israel that were beyond Jordan, in the land of the Amorites, which is in Gilead.
Moreover, the children of Ammon went over Jordan to fight against Judah and against Benjamin, and against the house of Ephraim: so that Israel was sore tormented.

Then the children of Israel (They prayed to the Lord, and confessed their sins.) cried unto the Lord, saying, We have sinned against thee, even because we have forsaken our own God, and have served Baal.

And the Lord (By stirring them up some prophets, as Judg. 6:8.) said unto the children of Israel, Did not I deliver you from the Egyptians and from the Amorites, from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines?
The Sidonians also, and the Amalekites, and the Maonites did oppress you, and ye cried to me, and I saved you out of their hands.
Yet ye (Deut. 32:15; Jer. 2:13) have forsaken me, and served other gods: Wherefore I will deliver you no more.
Go, and cry unto the gods which ye have chosen: let them save you in the time of your tribulation.
And the children of Israel said unto the Lord, We have sinned: do thou unto us whatsoever please thee: only we pray thee to deliver us (That is, from this present danger.) this day.

Then they put away the strange gods from among them, and (This is true repentance, to put away the evil, and to serve God aright.) served the Lord: and (Or, he pitied.) his soul was grieved for the misery of Israel.
Then the children of Ammon gathered themselves together, and pitched in Gilead: and the children of Israel assembled themselves, and pitched in Mizpah.
And the people and princes of Gilead said one to another, Whosoever will begin the battle against the children of Ammon, the same shall be (Judg. 11:6) head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
